𒌒 UB •UP OB 𓁷 ὤψ ṓps opus < QOOPH Kopf cephal 𓁶

𒀀 opus #epēšu 𒂊𒉿𒅖
𒀀 faire 𒀝 AK “act” do make

𒂊𒄫 e-piš opus
𒂊𒉿𒋗 e-pe-šu build, make, to do
𒂊𒉿𒋗 gepos ⇔ gebaut potentat

𒂊𒁍 e-pu 𒁍 buᵏ bake 𒁍 buˡ “full”
𒂊𒁍 to bake, to be thick ⇔ Gebäck bulk

𒐊𒁍 i-pu √opus 𒐊𒁍 he put, he made

𒂊𒁍𒍑 e-bu-us erbaut (he)built

opus 𓆣 schaffe shop opera opfer operation

𓂡 opus in

𓂝 𓍯 𓂡 ha[rob]]ˢ 𒄷𒁍𒌓 ʳḫubut (ˢ≈𓋴 in 𓂡 opus)

𓐍 𓈖 𓌰 𓅓 𓋴 𓀙 𓅯 𓏛 𓏥 | mosquito | κώνωψ kṓnōps “mosquito” κουνούπι kounoúpi 𓌰
𓐍 𓈖 𓌰 𓅓 𓋴 𓀙 𓀀 | friend, relative | conopus ⋍ comrade

𓅡𓎡𓀀 das Pack, der Puck, pfuck, pacht, pächter pactum “pact” fixed pāx peace pangō bind *peh₂ḱ- peg *bak- (“stick”)
baculum (“staff”), Latvian bakstît (“to poke”), Ancient Greek βάκτρον (báktron, “staff, walking stick”). Related to beak. βάκτρον (báktron), βακτηρία (baktēría) •ƒpακτ ⇔ “stick” ⇔ pack

𓂓 Work-shop 𓇋𓇩𓊃𓉐 𓇋𓇩𓋴𓉐 Werkstatt 𓅡𓎡𓂡

Caucasian verb suffix •opera ɑpʰɑrɑ ɑpʰ ɑrɑ •apra opus ара ɑrɑ ɑpʰ (vaire,ire)
ачаҧара ɑçɑpɑrɑ at͡ʃʰɑpʰɑrɑ

𒂊𒉿𒅖 e-pi-iš opus : to effect 𓆣
𒂊𒁍𒍑 e-pu-uš opus : erschaffen,made 𓆣
𒄿𒁍 i-pu : perform(ed)
𒅁𒁍𒊺𒄷 ep-pu-us : perform
𒂊𒄫 e-piš (sorcery)

⇔ faz potentat fait effekt able ⇔ beetle 𓆣
⇔ bear being 𒁀𒉌

semi unfamiliar suffix -up : cutup …

ר־כ־ב r-c-b •rückup
ר־כ־ב r-c-b Arabic رَكِبَ rakiba, “to embark” and Ugaritic 𐎗𐎋𐎁 rkb, “to ride, to mount”
רָכַב rakháv
to ride @ Rücken ⇔ ridge rückup
רֶכֶב rékhev
vehicle
A team (of horses or the like)
Cavalry •rékheval
A rider => an upper millstone

𓅓 𓂝 𓃭 𓏤 𓎡 𓄿 𓃀 𓏲 𓍘 𓇋 𓆱 horse chariot | 𐎎𐎗𐎋𐎁𐎚 mrkbt /markabtu/ Cannanean: markabti Akkadian: narkabtu
𓅓 𓂝 𓃭 𓏤 𓎡 𓄿 𓃀 𓏲 𓍘 𓇋 𓆱 horse chariot | մարտակառք martakaṙkʿ… מֶרְכָּבָה merkāḇā ⇔ مَرْكَب markab, “ship, saddle”

𒋼𒅁𒋾𒁴 te-ep-ti-tim تَهْذِيب tahḏīb 𒋼𒅁𒋾𒁴 cultivation <> 𒅁𒋾𒁴 ep-ti-tim 𐭠𐭡𐭠𐭣𐭠𐭭𐭩𐭤 ʾbʾdʾnyh /ābādānīh/ opus
